parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and dechomai; to admit (figuratively) endurance); by implication, to await.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To unloose, unloose for departure, depart, return. From ana and luo; to break up, i.e. Depart.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A marriage, wedding, wedding-ceremony; plur: a wedding-feast. Of uncertain affinity; nuptials.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To knock, beat a door with a stick, to gain admittance. Apparently a primary verb; to rap.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
